title: Got priority queue by duoing with friend with it....

embed.description: I played a FLEX 5V5 with a friend of mine which had rando's I didn't know and the minute the queue started I noticed there was a red triangle with a black exclamation point in the middle of it, thinking nothing of it I waited and played the game and won, however as soon as the game was ove

body:
I was playing with a friend who had priority queues (I MYSELF DIDN'T HAVE THEM), where a red triangle appeared next to the queue time. I knew it was the priority queue sign, and I waited out the time and played the game. 

After the game, I queued up MYSELF (without my friend who had it), and the red triangle was still there. Is this just an unfortunate bug? Or is this a legit thing riot has in place?

I looked at someone else's post (the link above), and a riot employee said that basically, this shouldn't happen so it might be a bug. So is there any way to fix it for me or do I have to wait out the games?

Any possible answers to my question are appreciated.

replies.body:
Ayyyyy that was me in the post your referenced ^_^!

This should just be a visual bug. I've checked your account, and you don't currently have a low-priority queue!

It's nothing but a visual bug, don't worry about it.

Me and my Duo have a good share of Leaverbuster queue timers between ourselves that we've got used to this bug, but it can be scary the first time you encounter it.

If it really bugs you just relog. Thats all it takes.
Thanks, I was getting somewhat upset since I didn't do anything and I was getting punished, but now I know it's just a bug :p
